section.sectiontext: The purpose of this Act is to implement a child care system that will

paragraph.paragraphtext: promote the health, safety and well-being of children receiving child care,
promote quality child care,
improve access to child care, including child care for children with special needs, and
provide financial help to families with limited incomes who need child care.

subsection.subsectiontext: The Provincial Child Care Council may make recommendations to the minister about child care.
The council consists of at least 14 and not more than 21 members, each of whom is appointed by the minister and one or more of whom is designated by the minister to chair council meetings.
The minister may set the term of office of any member of the council.

paragraph.paragraphtext: reimburse the members for reasonable travelling and out-of-pocket expenses necessarily incurred by them in attending council meetings, and
pay the members, for each day spent on the council's business, a fee set by the minister in accordance with the general directives of Treasury Board.

subsection.subsectiontext: A person may request the minister to reconsider a decision made under this Act or the regulations about

paragraph.paragraphtext: the refusal to pay a child care subsidy to or for the person, or
the discontinuance or reduction of the person's child care subsidy.

subsection.subsectiontext: The request must be made, and the decision reconsidered, within the time limits and in accordance with any rules specified by regulation.
If dissatisfied with the outcome, the person who made the request may appeal from the decision that was the outcome of the request to a tribunal appointed under the BC Benefits (Appeals) Act.
The right of appeal given by subsection (3) is subject to the time limits and other requirements set out in the BC Benefits (Appeals) Act and the regulations under that Act.
